title: Which human resource skills are essential for motivating employees to work on dead end technologies, as per client requirement, even when some employees are skilled enough to work on latest technologies? How can HR people develop such skills? - Quora

response.answer_text: Your premise is incorrect. There is no such thing as a dead-end technology. If the technology is being used by the client it is providing value. The employee’s job is to provide what the clients want at the contracted rate using the methods they are told to use. If HR wants the employees to use their skills for newer technologies they need to get clients that require those technologies and contract to put the skilled people in it. Or pay the employees to train in those skills.

Usually HR are not the ones who need to handle this for freshers, in case of a lateral hire, HR preferably reachout the guys who are already working on these dead end technologies they know any person who is working on latest technology ain't gonna fail for it. The final skill that remains with HR to hire a lateral who is working on latest technology to work on any dead end technologie is to offer the money. They offer the candidate huge salary, or sometime cheap out by offering niche skill bonus to kill it later ones candidate's work on dead Technologies is done
